title: Allele
description:
A variant form of a gene
Example: Eye color allele

title: Genotype
description:
Genetic makeup of an organism
Example: AA, Aa, or aa

title: Phenotype
description:
Observable traits of an organism
Example: Brown eyes

title: Dominant Trait
description:
A trait that masks another
Example: Brown eye color

title: Recessive Trait
description:
A trait that is masked by a dominant trait
Example: Blue eye color

title: Homozygous
description:
Having two identical alleles
Example: AA or aa

title: Heterozygous
description:
Having two different alleles
Example: Aa

title: Codominance
description:
Both alleles are equally expressed
Example: AB blood type

title: Incomplete Dominance
description:
Blended phenotype in heterozygotes
Example: Pink flowers from red and white parents

title: Polygenic Inheritance
description:
Traits controlled by multiple genes
Example: Skin color

title: Epistasis
description:
One gene affects another
Example: Albinism affecting pigmentation

title: Pleiotropy
description:
One gene affects multiple traits
Example: Sickle cell disease affecting multiple traits

title: Mutation
description:
A change in DNA sequence
Example: Cystic fibrosis mutation

title: Point Mutation
description:
A single nucleotide change
Example: Sickle cell mutation

title: Frameshift Mutation
description:
Insertion or deletion shifting the reading frame
Example: Tay-Sachs disease mutation

title: Silent Mutation
description:
Mutation that does not affect protein
Example: Silent change in hemoglobin gene

title: Missense Mutation
description:
Mutation changing one amino acid
Example: Sickle cell anemia

title: Nonsense Mutation
description:
Mutation creating a stop codon
Example: Duchenne muscular dystrophy

title: Gene Expression
description:
Process of using DNA instructions to make proteins
Example: Insulin production

title: Transcription
description:
Conversion of DNA to RNA
Example: RNA polymerase activity

title: Translation
description:
RNA to protein process
Example: Ribosome function

title: RNA Splicing
description:
Editing of RNA before translation
Example: mRNA editing

title: Promoter Region
description:
DNA sequence controlling gene expression
Example: TATA box in promoter

title: Enhancer Sequence
description:
DNA sequence enhancing transcription
Example: Enhancer regulating growth genes

title: Operon Model
description:
Gene regulation model in bacteria
Example: Lac operon in bacteria

title: Repressor Protein
description:
Protein that inhibits gene expression
Example: Repressor blocking transcription

title: Inducer
description:
Molecule that activates gene expression
Example: Lactose inducing lac operon

title: Exon
description:
Protein-coding sequence of a gene
Example: Exons in hemoglobin gene

title: Intron
description:
Non-coding sequence removed during splicing
Example: Introns in globin genes

title: Spliceosome
description:
Complex that removes introns
Example: Spliceosome removing introns

title: Messenger RNA
description:
RNA carrying genetic information
Example: mRNA carrying hemoglobin code

title: Ribosomal RNA
description:
RNA making up ribosomes
Example: rRNA forming ribosomes

title: Transfer RNA
description:
RNA delivering amino acids
Example: tRNA delivering methionine

title: Genetic Code
description:
Set of rules translating RNA into protein
Example: AUG for methionine

title: Codon
description:
Three-letter RNA sequence coding for an amino acid
Example: UAA stop codon

title: Anticodon
description:
Three-letter sequence on tRNA complementary to codon
Example: DNA polymerase copying DNA

title: Start Codon
description:
AUG codon that starts translation
Example: Okazaki fragments on lagging strand

title: Stop Codon
description:
UAA, UAG, or UGA codon ending translation
Example: Leading strand in replication

title: DNA Replication
description:
Process of copying DNA
Example: Lagging strand in replication

title: Okazaki Fragment
description:
Short DNA segments synthesized on the lagging strand
Example: Telomere shortening with age

title: Leading Strand
description:
Continuously synthesized DNA strand
Example: Telomerase in stem cells

title: Lagging Strand
description:
Discontinuous DNA strand
Example: DNA polymerase proofreading

title: Telomere
description:
Protective ends of chromosomes
Example: RNA polymerase transcribing RNA

title: Telomerase
description:
Enzyme maintaining telomeres
Example: Helicase unwinding DNA

title: DNA Polymerase
description:
Enzyme synthesizing new DNA strands
Example: Topoisomerase preventing DNA knots

title: RNA Polymerase
description:
Enzyme synthesizing RNA
Example: Ligase joining Okazaki fragments

title: Helicase
description:
Enzyme unwinding DNA
Example: Chromatin in cell nuclei

title: Topoisomerase
description:
Enzyme preventing DNA supercoiling
Example: Histones in nucleosomes

title: Ligase
description:
Enzyme sealing DNA fragments
Example: Nucleosome compacting DNA

title: Chromatin
description:
DNA-protein complex in the nucleus
Example: Euchromatin in active genes

title: Histones
description:
Proteins around which DNA winds
Example: Heterochromatin in inactive genes

title: Nucleosome
description:
DNA-histone complex forming chromatin units
Example: Chromosome 21 mapped for Down syndrome

title: Euchromatin
description:
Loosely packed chromatin
Example: Huntington’s disease

title: Heterochromatin
description:
Densely packed chromatin
Example: Cystic fibrosis

title: Chromosome Mapping
description:
Method to determine gene locations on chromosomes
Example: Hemophilia

title: Autosomal Dominant Disorder
description:
A disorder inherited from a single dominant allele
Example: Leber’s hereditary optic neuropathy

title: Autosomal Recessive Disorder
description:
A disorder requiring two recessive alleles
Example: Down syndrome

title: X-linked Disorder
description:
A disorder linked to genes on the X chromosome
Example: Trisomy 21

title: Mitochondrial Disorder
description:
A disorder caused by mutations in mitochondrial DNA
Example: XXY syndrome

title: Chromosomal Aberration
description:
A structural change in chromosomes
Example: Monosomy X

title: Down Syndrome
description:
A condition with an extra chromosome 21
Example: Extra fingers in cats

title: Klinefelter Syndrome
description:
A condition with an extra X chromosome in males
Example: Royal family hemophilia

title: Turner Syndrome
description:
A condition where females have only one X chromosome
Example: Thick mucus in lungs

title: Polydactyly
description:
Extra fingers or toes
Example: White tigers

title: Hemophilia
description:
Blood clotting disorder due to a missing protein
Example: Sickle-shaped RBCs

title: Cystic Fibrosis
description:
A disorder affecting lung mucus production
Example: Duchenne muscular dystrophy

title: Albinism
description:
Lack of melanin causing pale skin and vision issues
Example: Brain lipid accumulation

title: Sickle Cell Anemia
description:
Red blood cells becoming sickle-shaped
Example: Motor dysfunction in adults

title: Muscular Dystrophy
description:
Progressive muscle degeneration
Example: Tall individuals with long limbs

title: Tay-Sachs Disease
description:
Lipid accumulation in the brain leading to death
Example: Phenylalanine buildup

title: Huntington’s Disease
description:
A degenerative brain disorder
Example: Weak muscles in dogs

title: Marfan Syndrome
description:
A disorder affecting connective tissue
Example: Copper buildup in liver

title: PKU (Phenylketonuria)
description:
A metabolic disorder affecting phenylalanine breakdown
Example: Low thyroid hormones

title: Spinal Muscular Atrophy
description:
A genetic disorder causing muscle wasting
Example: Mental impairment

title: Wilson’s Disease
description:
Copper metabolism disorder
Example: Benign tumors on nerves

title: Congenital Hypothyroidism
description:
A thyroid hormone deficiency present at birth
Example: Red-green color blindness

title: Fragile X Syndrome
description:
An inherited intellectual disability disorder
Example: Dwarfism in dogs

title: Neurofibromatosis
description:
A genetic disorder causing tumors in the nervous system
Example: Eye tumor in children

title: Color Blindness
description:
A vision disorder where certain colors can't be distinguished
Example: Short fingers

title: Achondroplasia
description:
A disorder causing short-limbed dwarfism
Example: Cat-like cry in infants

title: Retinoblastoma
description:
A childhood eye cancer
Example: Insatiable hunger

title: Brachydactyly
description:
A condition causing short, broad fingers
Example: Frequent laughter

title: Cri-du-chat Syndrome
description:
A chromosomal deletion disorder affecting development
Example: Hyperflexible joints

title: Prader-Willi Syndrome
description:
A disorder causing excessive hunger and obesity
Example: Hearing loss and blue eyes

title: Angelman Syndrome
description:
A disorder causing developmental delays and laughter
Example: Bone marrow failure

title: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
description:
A disorder affecting connective tissue flexibility
Example: Enlarged liver

title: Waardenburg Syndrome
description:
A disorder affecting hearing and pigmentation
Example: Seizures in German Shepherds

title: Fanconi Anemia
description:
A disorder causing bone marrow failure
Example: Kidney cysts in Persian cats

title: Gaucher’s Disease
description:
A disorder affecting lipid metabolism
Example: Small ponies

title: Canine Epilepsy
description:
A hereditary seizure disorder in dogs
Example: PSS in pigs

title: Feline Polycystic Kidney Disease
description:
A genetic kidney disease in cats
Example: Immune deficiency in cattle

title: Equine Dwarfism
description:
A dwarfism condition in horses
Example: Dolly the sheep

title: Porcine Stress Syndrome
description:
A stress-related muscle disorder in pigs
Example: Cloning livestock

title: Bovine Leukocyte Adhesion Deficiency
description:
An immune system disorder in cattle
Example: Stem cell research

title: Somatic Cell Nuclear Transfer
description:
A cloning technique transferring a nucleus from a somatic cell into an egg cell
Example: Curing genetic disorders

title: Reproductive Cloning
description:
Cloning to create an identical organism
Example: Bt cotton

title: Therapeutic Cloning
description:
Cloning for medical treatments
Example: GloFish

title: Gene Therapy
description:
Treatment by correcting defective genes
Example: Knockout mice

title: Genetically Modified Organism (GMO)
description:
Organism modified with foreign DNA
Example: CRISPR gene therapy

title: Transgenic Animal
description:
Animal with genes from another species
Example: Editing disease genes

title: Knockout Gene
description:
Gene intentionally deactivated
Example: Crime scene DNA analysis

title: Gene Editing
description:
Altering genes for specific traits
Example: Insulin production in goats

title: CRISPR-Cas9
description:
Tool for precise DNA modification
Example: Biotech fermentation

title: DNA Fingerprinting
description:
DNA analysis for identification
Example: Regenerating tissues

title: Biopharming
description:
Using animals to produce pharmaceuticals
Example: Embryo-derived stem cells

title: Bioreactor
description:
System for growing biotech products
Example: Reprogrammed skin cells

title: Stem Cell Therapy
description:
Using stem cells for regeneration
Example: Plasmid cloning

title: Embryonic Stem Cells
description:
Cells from embryos capable of becoming any cell
Example: Bacterial plasmids

title: Induced Pluripotent Stem Cells (iPSCs)
description:
Adult cells reprogrammed to stem-like state
Example: Forensic DNA testing

title: Cloning Vector
description:
DNA molecule carrying foreign DNA
Example: DNA profiling

title: Plasmid
description:
Small circular DNA in bacteria
Example: Genetic screening

title: Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR)
description:
Technique to amplify DNA
Example: GM mouse production

title: Gel Electrophoresis
description:
Method to separate DNA fragments
Example: Introducing DNA via electricity

title: Southern Blot
description:
Technique to detect specific DNA sequences
Example: Silencing viral genes

title: Microinjection
description:
Direct injection of DNA into cells
Example: Genetic research

title: Electroporation
description:
Using electricity to introduce DNA into cells
Example: X-chromosome inactivation

title: Gene Silencing
description:
Shutting down gene expression
Example: Cancer epigenetics

title: RNA Interference (RNAi)
description:
Using small RNA molecules to block gene function
Example: Histone acetylation

title: Epigenetic Modification
description:
Changes to gene expression without altering DNA sequence
Example: Human genome library

title: DNA Methylation
description:
Adding methyl groups to DNA to regulate genes
Example: Hybridoma cell lines

title: Histone Modification
description:
Modifying histones to influence gene activity
Example: Therapeutic antibodies

title: Genomic Library
description:
Collection of cloned DNA fragments
Example: Pig organ transplants

title: Hybridoma Technology
description:
Fusing cells to produce hybrid antibodies
Example: Tracking cancer cells

title: Monoclonal Antibodies
description:
Antibodies from a single cell clone
Example: Building artificial genes

title: Xenotransplantation
description:
Transplanting animal organs into humans
Example: Improving enzymes

title: Bioluminescence Imaging
description:
Using glowing proteins to track genes
Example: Human genome sequencing

title: Synthetic Biology
description:
Designing new biological systems
Example: Microbial community sequencing

title: Protein Engineering
description:
Modifying proteins for specific functions
Example: Malaria gene drive

title: DNA Sequencing
description:
Determining the sequence of DNA bases
Example: Cancer biomarkers

title: Whole Genome Sequencing
description:
Sequencing the entire genome
Example: Genomic medicine

title: Metagenomics
description:
Studying genetic material from environmental samples
Example: Human cloning debate

title: Gene Drive
description:
Spreading genetic modifications in populations
Example: FDA regulations

title: Biomarker
description:
Molecule indicating disease or condition
Example: Laboratory safety

title: Personalized Medicine
description:
Tailoring treatments to an individual's genes
Example: Milk-producing GM cows

title: Cloning Ethics
description:
Debates over cloning morality
Example: 3D-printed tissues
